page.title: 13WOODFORD VALLEY ARCHITECTURE
page.content: The cottages in this area are of cob or an attractive checker board effect of squares of flint and rose red brick. They are either thatched or slated. Heale House is built of brick and is Carolean. There are several beautiful, Georgian, brick built houses and there has been some recent development, particularly in Upper Woodford, which manages to blend in well with these. There is a local thatcher whose trade-mark is a pheasant, which can be seen perched cheerfully on many a cottage roof. It is painted realistically. This is a most favoured area and whenever houses come on to the market, they are snapped up at very high prices.
